channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10268] TestSplitLogWorker occasionally fails
item.description: TestSplitLogWorker failed in 10% of 50 runs of the 0.98 branch test suite, but only when using JDK 6 on Ubuntu 12.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Can you point me to a jenkins run where it failed?
I ran the suite on an EC2 box. You may need to set up for JDK 6 + Ubuntu 12 to replicate with a reasonable number of iterations.

Running this test in a loop in 0.98, Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_34-b04), Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.
63 times so far, not seen a failure.
Thanks. If you can't reproduce it let me know and I'll dig in.

Ran a few hundred times in my env. No error.
Might be a time related issue that occurs on VM/Jenkins only...?

The order of test file executions differ a bit by filesystem and kernel version - this is due to how readdir() works. The test doesn't fail on its own. I may have a system 'uniquely' suited to reproducing this. What about this test would be sensitive to another hanging around for a bit?

I can reproduce this using JDK 6 on RHEL 6 also.

Example:

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitLogWorker

Tests run: 7, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 12.276 sec <<< FAILURE!

[...]

Failed tests:   testRescan(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitLogWorker):

Waiting timed out after [1,500] msec

First thought is 1.5 seconds is a very short timeout period.

Fix or disable for 0.98.0 release.
Add default test case timeouts. When waiting internally, uniformly use a timeout of 10s.

I could get this test to fail within a few iterations on one box. Now 25 have passed in succession with the attached patch. Will continue out to 100 iterations. If they all pass and HadoopQA provides a good result here, I am going to commit this test only fix.
Should be good for 0.94 (and presumably 0.96) as well.
The test itself timed out on run #56. Trying again with 120s timeouts per test. Beyond that, this is going to need a deeper look.

Should be good for 0.94 (and presumably 0.96) as well.

Sure Lars Hofhansl. And stack made a comment up on dev@ about TestSplitLogWorker, I suspect he won't mind a test fix in 0.96 also. If I don't make things worse by introducing too short junit test timeouts (working on it) then I will commit this everywhere.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12622072/10268.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12622072

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 4 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Almost identical patch as previous but with WAIT_TIME set to 15000. I plan to commit this tomorrow morning unless objection.

Committed to trunk, 0.98, 0.96, and 0.94.

Time (and Jenkins) will tell if I've introduced a new problem by decorating the junit tests with our customary 60s timeout.
